datastructures

Class BinaryTree<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • datastructures.BinaryTree<E>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinarySearchTree

    public class BinaryTree<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    The Binary Tree class which specifies the functionality of the Binary Tree its basic attributes, and the way it stores data

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Node<E> root 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryTree()
      Default Constructor Creates an empty binary tree
      BinaryTree(E data, BinaryTree<E> leftTree, BinaryTree<E> rightTree)
      Construct a new binary tree with data in its root and leftTree as the left subtree rightTree as the right subtree

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      E getItemData()
      Checks if the binary tree's empty and if it is not, return the tree's data
      BinaryTree<E> getLeftTree()
      Checks if the binary tree's specified root and the left part of the tree is empty, if not return the left side of the current tree
      BinaryTree<E> getRightTree()
      Checks if the binary tree's specified root and the right part of the tree is empty, if not return the right side of the current tree
      Node<E> getRoot()
      Getter for the root of the Binary Search Tree
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the binary tree's specified root is empty
      boolean isLeaf()
      Checks if the current node of the tree is a leaf

      Setter for the root of the Binary Search Tree
      java.lang.String toString()
      Standard toString function of the BinaryTree object
